metadata.title: CVE-2018-10992 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
lilypond-invoke-editor in LilyPond 2.19.80 does not validate strings beforelaunching the program specified by the BROWSER environment variable, whichallows remote attackers to conduct argument-injection attacks via a craftedURL, as demonstrated by a --proxy-pac-file argument, because the GNU Guilecode uses the system Scheme procedure instead of the system* Schemeprocedure. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix forCVE-2017-17523.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10992` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lilypond - 2.19.81+really-2.18.2-13
lilypond-data - 2.19.81+really-2.18.2-13
lilypond-fonts - 2.19.81+really-2.18.2-13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lilypond package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.19.81+really-2.18.2-13').
